New Records: Jayson Tatum flirted with a triple-double, racking up 33 points, nine assists, and eight boards
Key Match Events: The Timberwolves trailed by eight with two minutes to play but they had a chance to send it into overtime
Anthony Edwards’ three-pointer fell short at the buzzer
Giannis Antetokounmpo couldn’t finish on his drive to the basket
Damian Lillard missed two potential tying three-point attempts in the last 4.1 seconds
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum had 33 points, nine assists and eight rebounds, and the Boston Celtics beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 118-115 on Thursday night
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics won despite being short-handed
The Thunder won their franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season game
Stephen Curry had 30 points and made all eight of his 3-point attempts, and Golden State beat Philadelphia
LeBron James scored 38 points, Max Christie had a career-high 28 and Los Angeles overcame Anthony Davis’ absence for a 114-106 victory over Portland Trail
Others: Jaylen Brown was injured and Sam Hauser filled in for him
The Celtics led by eight with two minutes to play
The Timberwolves had a chance to send it into overtime but Anthony Edwards’ three-pointer fell short
